Package acctMgr.model

Class AccountList

  • java.lang.Object
    • acctMgr.model.AbstractModel
      • acctMgr.model.AccountList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Model
    public class AccountList
extends AbstractModel
    Maintains account list. All accounts in account list have a unique id.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jon Pierre

      • removeAccount

        public boolean removeAccount​(int accountID)
        Parameters:
        accountID - int unique account id
        Returns:
        true if account found and removed, false if account not found

      • loadAccount

        public void loadAccount​(java.lang.String fileName)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                        IllegalFileFormatException,
                        java.util.NoSuchElementException
        loads account file into account list. The current list is replaced with the accounts in the loaded file if the accounts are correctly formatted and the operation is successful. Otherwise, exception is thrown, the current account list is unchanged and all resources used are freed. The delimiters used for account attributes in file are static AccountList attributes.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String name of the file to read
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - iff fileName path not found
        IllegalFileFormatException - iff file is not formatted correctly
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if if file is not formatted correctly

      • saveAccount

        public boolean saveAccount​(java.lang.String fileName)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        writes current account list to file. If the file exists it's replaced, and if the file does not exist it's created. If the accounts have not been modified since last load, the file is not written. The delimiters used for account attributes in file are static AccountList attributes.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String name of the file to read
        Returns:
        false if accounts have not been modified since last load
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if accessing file
